tva:BasicDescription.tva:Title: Bill Nye: Creationism Is Not Appropriate For Children
tva:BasicDescription.tva:Synopsis: Evolution is the fundamental idea in all of life science, in all of biology. According to Bill Nye, aka "the science guy," if grownups want to "deny evolution and live in your world that's completely inconsistent with everything we observe in the universe, that's fine, but don't make your kids do it because we need them." -- Transcript: Denial of evolution is unique to the United States. I mean, we're the world's most advanced technological—I mean, you could say Japan—but generally, the United States is where most of the innovations still happens. People still move to the United States. And that's largely because of the intellectual capital we have, the general understanding of science. When you have a portion of the population that doesn't believe in that, it holds everybody back, really. Evolution is the fundamental idea in all of life science, in all of biology. It's like, it's very much analogous to trying to do geology without believing in tectonic plates. You're just not going to get the right answer. Your whole world is just going to be a mystery instead of an exciting place. As my old professor, Carl Sagan, said, "When you're in love you want to tell the world." So, once in a while I get people that really—or that claim—they don't believe in evolution. And my response generally is "Well, why not? Really, why not?" Your world just becomes fantastically complicated when you don't believe in evolution. I mean, here are these ancient dinosaur bones or fossils, here is ...

tva:Review.tva:FreeTextReview: But, the fact we never saw "non-biologic components able to be﻿ transformed into biological components" only give us the right to elaborate a theory suggesting they do not exist. Non knowledge of evidence does not means absence of evidence. So you have a theory, anything else, and a good theory. I have other theory with pictured models suggesting that the astronomical state of the world was not "non-biological" but half-mechanical/half-biological, is only theory but can be falsified.

Some people prefer to live in their close minded world of this all-knowing being as their explanation to everything. It eases the mind of the less curious and easily anxious people. I agree with Bill. I feel this idea will eventually die out. I feel religion and similar beliefs were used to create a mindset that there was something after life. To ensure people of something better because, let's face it, life sucked back then. It was their glimpse of hope in their entire lives﻿ of turmoil.

There was an experiment done in 1952 (which can be reproduced in a﻿ school lab) where amino acids (the building blocks of life) were made in a lab using conditions similar to that of early earth. It's called the Miller--Urey experiment, look it up on Wikipedia.

Biologists should be on top of the origin of the programming﻿ of life forms and they hardly even know what that is. ...so much for the "peer-review" system. They merely *assume* life started and they *assume* that life restarted,﻿ recalibrated and reprogrammed itself billions of times over without a reason! Their belief just has no relationship with any part of reality. Matter only does what it's made to do and proves you have a Maker. PROOF OF GOD in less than 10 seconds... watch?v=_hLWx0cgOps
We agree. The biblical god *is*﻿ an idea. Just like all the other gods.

Since when did the word species stop a salamander that can no﻿ longer breed with its original population NOT a salamander? Do you think that species means so different that they can't be related? If so, you were misinformed.

Im giving these ideological nuts here, at least the gift of hypothetically assuming such an idea could be a creature. for to me, it is a﻿ creature for nothing so far has the power to harness the power of our universe and use it as its play thing that can be considered human. such a creature if it had this type of control would never have bothered with the human race, for the universe is more interesting than we could ever be.

Naw, the two species are doing just fine all healthy and happy. DNA was taken from the different species and indeed, its true. They developed a﻿ breeding isolation mechanism. Breeding isolating mechanism means "species."
I am Catholic I will﻿ pray for you.

Bill Nye thinks that iddy bitty pieces of matter made him what he is. Yes, he thinks pieces of matter are able to do magic. He believes objects have the power to make life forms and human beings. That's naturalism, paganism, nonsense equal to idol worship and black magic giving credit to things that do nothing of themselves. It is idiocy that he wants to teach your children! Matter only﻿ does what it's made to do and proves you have a Maker PROOF OF GOD in less than 10 seconds watch?v=_hLWx0cgOps

"which requires an increase in genetic information"
1. No it doesn't, and 2.﻿ *New* genetic "information" is seen to emerge and *increases* in genetic "information" are also *observed* to emerge through simple genetic mechanisms.

Fact #2 -- ring species are not an example of evolution, which requires an increase in genetic information. They are an example of a loss of genetic﻿ information, a degradation of life, and the opposite of what evolution is supposed to be. There is no support for evolution in ring species. Because ring species show the effects of genetic degradation, they demonstrate we live in a fallen world created by God.
It is the same evidence that is used for evolution. Over and over this has to be pointed out. I just I think the evidence fits the﻿ proposition for creation better than for evolution.

Then you have no definition for "kind" on which to base your statement that eveything must keep to its kind?
In other words, evolutionary theory is as much consistent with this statement﻿ as the belief of creationism?

Jeez, this comment section is a battlefield. How about this? If you believe there's a God- take a look at his lessons of mercy and acceptance and just coexist with your fellow man in spite of differing beliefs. If you believe in the miracle of nature, and the fact that we evolved to where we﻿ are now in spite of nearly impossible odds, the dizzying fact that we're even here should be enough to humble you into living life with as little conflict as possible. Enjoy the ride! Love your fellow human
No, you think that. Magic sky genie﻿ go poof.

Did nobody else here bother to learn even the slightest bit of background knowledge before going﻿ on and slandering this? Not only are you people making fools of yourselves, you are also making a fool of your religion.

WOW, you do realize that the scientific explanation for life creating is﻿ a THEORY and not fact right?
The primordial soup theory is a legitimate study... I wish I could take credit for it by pulling it out my ass as you suggested... but maybe if you spent more time in school and were more open-minded you would have learned that.

I will ignore further comments demonstrating ignorance of the meaning of the term 'scientific theory'. Explaining again and again what it means for a model to be a scientific theory is just getting too tiresome.
You lot who don't understand scientific principles: come back when﻿ you do.
god is no creature. god﻿ is an idea.

"it's still called﻿ a "theory" but that is only because it can't be proven"
O, good gods, another one who didn't bother reading up on ANY subject related to the discussion before coming here to complain about his own lack of understanding.

So just because creationism﻿ is wrong on saying when our universe was created... you dismiss all of it? I believe in both evolution and creationism... I recognize creationism's flaws but use its other information to fill in the blanks that science can't (or has yet) to explain.
